channel.title: The U2F Garden
channel.description: Recent content on The U2F Garden

item.title: Hello, World!
item.description: Welcome to the U2F Garden! The goal of the U2F Garden is to provide a guide on the many and varied U2F tokens and keys out there in the world. There’s a lot of them out there and I wanted to make sure that there was a good guide on what keys support what features. Where’d this all start? This started when I wanted to make a small adjustment to my typical SSH configuration.

item.title: About The U2F Garden
item.description: The goal of the U2F Garden is to collect information on the many FIDO/U2F/WebAuthn tokens, organizing them into categories.

item.title: ePASS FIDO NFC
item.description: An NFC option that provides more than you’d expect.

item.title: ePASS FIDO2
item.description: Feitian’s ePASS Fido2 series provides a standards compliant U2F option for a low price.

item.title: ePASS FIDO2 Biometric
item.description: Feitian’s biometric options bring fingerprint authentication for additional security

item.title: Frequently Asked Questions
item.description: Here are some common questions people ask: Why should I use a security token over an SMS authentication tool? SMS messages can – and have – been intercepted in the past. Attackers use techniques like SIM swapping to hijack messages and even phone calls. Learn more about SIM Swapping attacks and what the FCC is doing about them Weaknesses in mobile telephone networks Do I need a different token for every site?

item.title: GoTrust IdemKey
item.description: GoTrust’s IdemKey is the first FIDO2 Level 2 certified U2F token on the market.

item.title: HyperFIDO Pro Mini
item.description: Small and unassuming, good for a desktop with occasional travel.

item.title: HyperFIDO Titanium PRO
item.description: No-frills and durable, HyperSECU’s HyperFIDO Titanium Pro provides a basic option for keychains.

item.title: Thetis FIDO2 Security key
item.description: Thetis' line of FIDO2 U2F tokens are durable, inconspicuous, and simple.

item.title: Titan Key (Gen1)
item.description: No longer supported, but comprehensive solution to account security.

item.title: Titan Security Key (Gen3)
item.description: Google’s current generation of U2F tokens, the third generation continues the tradition.

item.title: TrustKey T110
item.description: TrustKey’s entry level token provides a large number of options for authentication but requires software for non-U2F features.

item.title: Why use U2F Tokens?
item.description: When you log into a website, you’re probably used to using your username and password. Increasingly, however, phishing and other social engineering attacks are getting better and better. In a modern world, hardware security tokens like U2F tokens help keep attackers from taking advantage of us. What is Two-Factor authentication? Two factor authentication (2FA) is a way that websites can secure accounts. In order to log in, you must present two forms of authentication:

item.title: Yubico FIDO Security Key NFC
item.description: A cut-down Yubikey, the Security Key series provides a classic form with wide function.

item.title: Yubikey 5
item.description: Yubico’s flagship product, the Yubikey 5 is one of the most feature complete security tokens on the market.
